main event: Multiple UFO incidents reported in 1947 in California, including sightings by a USAF pilot, a test pilot, and other observers.
interesting points: The incident is from 1947, a notable year for UFO reports such as the Roswell incident.
The report suggests a possible weather balloon explanation due to ascending warm air currents over the desert giving the illusion of object oscillation.
Descriptions include a circular and flat object, estimated to be 3 to 10 feet in diameter, as well as spherical objects with a diameter of 10 feet and traveling at 200 to 225 MPH.
No photographs or sketches of the reported objects were included in the document.
Evaluation indices by Dr. Hynek categorized the incidents into various probabilities, including astronomical and non-astronomical explanations as well as those lacking evident explanation.
sighted object: various unidentified objects including spheres and circular, flat objects
witnesses: USAF pilot, test pilot, and multiple other observers
